definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: I'm feeling really dopey this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天上午我一直昏昏沉沉的。

sentences.english: Staring through the window, I saw the snake like lighting crawling on the gray and heavy sky.
sentences.chinese: 透过窗，只见那电蛇在黑沉沉的天空蜿蜒。

sentences.english: Two and a half hours later, she emerges, dazed and emotional.
sentences.chinese: 两个半小时后，她昏昏沉沉地出现在我面前。

sentences.english: With the radio on, grandma slept deeply in the chair .
sentences.chinese: 无线电收音机开者，祖母在椅子里沉沉的入睡。

sentences.english: So close, that when you close your eyes, I fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 如此靠近，当你闭上你的双眼，我沉沉入睡。

sentences.english: Exhaust fumes made him drowsy and brought on a headache.
sentences.chinese: 废气把他熏得昏昏沉沉，还引起了头疼。

sentences.english: You may experience what I call the fog of brain.
sentences.chinese: 你也许会经历我先前所说的大脑昏昏沉沉这个状态。

sentences.english: The waiting-room was gloomy, of course, and it smelled badly.
sentences.chinese: 候车室阴沉沉的，那个味儿如一惯地难闻。

sentences.english: The people who lowering , blowsperson cold wind , makes free from likes it.
sentences.chinese: 阴沉沉的，吹者寒风，不受人喜欢。

sentences.english: I was very tired, and soon I fell into a very deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我疲累不堪，很快就沉沉入睡了。

sentences.english: The curtains opened to reveal a darkened stage.
sentences.chinese: 帷幕拉开，显出暗沉沉的舞台。

sentences.english: We found a drab little joint shoddily decorated for the holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了一家死气沉沉的小餐馆。

sentences.english: My toys, the ones in my personal collection, are anything but inanimate!
sentences.chinese: 我所收集的情趣玩具中，没有一件是死气沉沉的。

sentences.english: The fluctuating love disappears in the spring suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 浮浮沉沉的爱恋骤然消失在春天。

sentences.english: The afternoon drifted by heavily, inducing sleep.
sentences.chinese: 下午在沉重的睡眠中昏昏沉沉地度过。

definition: to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
